Comment 1: 
The status quo leads to code like this:

if !closed(c) {
    c <- msg
}

which could still crash mysteriously when one has a larger number of goroutines sending
messages to each other, like in a server where each client session is encapsulated in a
goroutine+channel and sessions send many messages to each other.

In this kind of program the "0 option" and the "Emax < âˆž option" make it really
hard to write correct code that *always* works.
